channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: ServiceNow, Coreweave and others to invest $8.2 billion in UK data centers to fuel AI growth
item.description: American enterprise software giant ServiceNow and cloud computing startup CoreWeave plan to invest billions of dollars in their U.K. operations.

item.title: UK trade deals with India and Gulf nations are 'the priority,’ business minister says
item.description: The U.K. said Monday that securing deals with India and Gulf nations remains "the priority" for Labour's free trade agenda, with talks between Britain and the Gulf Corporation Council expected to resume as soon as next week.

item.title: Nvidia heads for record close as AI chipmaker's market cap tops $3.4 trillion
item.description: Nvidia shares headed for an all-time high on Monday as the chipmaker continues to ride a massive wave of demand for its AI chips.

item.title: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer vows to slash regulatory red tape in bid to boost investment
item.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Monday vowed to slash regulatory red tape to boost anaemic investment in the country.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hikes its SiriusXM stake to 32% after Liberty deal
item.description: Berkshire hiked its bet after Liberty Media completed its deal in early September to combine its tracking stocks with the rest of the entertainment company.

item.title: Nobel economics prize for 2024 awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James Robinson
item.description: The winner of the award, officially the "Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel," receives $1 million.

item.title: European Central Bank set for third interest rate cut of the year in meeting this week
item.description: Markets are eyeing two more rate cuts from the euro area's central bank this year amid a weak growth outlook and lower inflation.

item.title: China's Ministry of Finance is taking aim at local debt problems before tackling broader economic challenges
item.description: In his opening remarks on Saturday, Minister of Finance Lan Fo'an laid out four measures, starting with increasing support for local governments in resolving debt risks.

item.title: Protesters in Spain told tourists to 'go home.' Instead more arrived.
item.description: Tourist arrivals to Spain increased following anti-tourism protests earlier this year. But organizers against mass tourism say the fight is far from over.

item.title: Elon Musk is on track to become a trillionaire by 2027. Here's why the rich keep getting richer
item.description: Wealthier individuals typically have larger portions of their assets in the stock market, while middle-income households hold more wealth in real estate.

item.title: Boeing factory strike crosses 1-month mark as pressure mounts on new CEO
item.description: Boeing's CEO Ortberg will answer to investors in his first Oct. 23 earnings presentation as the aerospace giant faces swirling crises.

item.title: SpaceX’s Starship rocket completes fifth test flight, lands booster in dramatic catch
item.description: SpaceX launched its fifth test flight of its Starship rocket on Sunday, taking a major step forward in the vehicle's development.

item.title: International investors descend on London as Labour tries to woo new business to Britain
item.description: Uncertainty around the event and suspected tax changes in the upcoming budget has left many investors in the dark.

item.title: Stripe, Wise founders want a 'tech renaissance' in Europe to help region rival Silicon Valley
item.description: Founders of some of Europe's largest technology unicorns are calling for the creation of a single pan-European entity to promote startups and innovation.

item.title: Crude oil prices fall nearly 2% after OPEC cuts demand forecast again
item.description: Soft demand in China has weighed on the market for months.

item.title: China's exports and imports grew far less than expected in September
item.description: China was expected Monday to report a slowdown in export growth in September versus August.

item.title: China property stocks jump after Beijing proposes measures to lift troubled sector
item.description: The rally came after China's Ministry of Finance outlined new policy measures focused on stabilizing the beleaguered real estate.

item.title: Trump to move fast on tariffs, says Wall Street firm, citing clients who met with ex-trade chief
item.description: Lighthizer, the U.S. trade representative during Trump's first term, is a top prospect for a number of potential Cabinet posts if Trump wins the White House.

item.title: Macao's next leader wants to wean its economy off gambling
item.description: Slated to become Macao's leader, Sam Hou Fai says he will continue to steer its economy away from gaming and gambling.

item.title: Chinese finance minister hints at increasing the deficit at highly anticipated briefing
item.description: Lan Fo'an emphasized that the space for a deficit increase is "rather large," but noted such policies are still under discussion.

item.title: The Federal Reserve may have pretty much just hit its 2% inflation target
item.description: In fact, economists at Goldman Sachs think the Fed may already be there.

item.title: Global trade at risk as tensions escalate in South China Sea
item.description: Rising naval tensions in the South China Sea are increasingly posing risks to some of the world’s most vital shipping lanes, experts warn.

item.title: Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen during factory strike
item.description: Boeing said it will lay off about 10% of its workforce as its losses deepen from an ongoing factory strike.

item.title: Hyper-local vs. hyper-focused: Two China ETFs go on different paths
item.description: While the Rayliant Quantamental China Equity ETF dives into specific regions, the new Roundhill China Dragons ETF focuses on the country’s biggest companies.

item.title: French budget surprises with focus on tax hikes as analysts warn of ratings downgrades
item.description: While tax hikes are focused on big corporations and high earners, the budget also contains politically-controversial measures.

item.title: Prosecutors seek years in prison for Trump Media insider trading Shvartsman brothers
item.description: Three men convicted of insider trading related to a company's planned merger with Trump Media are awaiting sentences in New York federal court.

item.title: Tesla shares drop 9% after Cybercab robotaxi reveal 'underwhelmed' investors
item.description: Tesla shares tumbled on Friday after the company's long-awaited robotaxi event failed to impress investors.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says geopolitical risks are surging: 'Conditions are treacherous and getting worse'
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon sees risks climbing around the world amid widening conflicts in the Middle East.

item.title: Saudi sovereign wealth fund allocates $5.2 billion in green bonds project amid diversification push
item.description: The PIF issued $8.5 billion in green bonds in 2022 and 2023, becoming the first sovereign wealth fund to issue that class of bond.

item.title: Novo and Lilly contender Zealand Pharma heralds its obesity drug alternative: It's our 'crown jewel'
item.description: Danish biotech Zealand Pharma is targeting the "next generation" of weight loss drugs as competitors pile into a market dominated by heavyweights Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.
